page.title: 09SEA RESCUE, SIDMOUTH
page.content: On Friday the 21st of June the Exmouth Lifeboat was called out to rescue a 40ft yacht that was in danger of being driven ashore at Sidmouth. The ketch Vamoss 2 was swept towards cliffs in force 6 winds when she sent out a distress call. The Caroline Finch lifeboat was launched and the crew reported that they had succesfully placed a line aboard the yacht and were towing her clear of the shore. The Caroline Finch lifeboat is not allowed out to a rescue if the weather is too rough. She is a brede class boat which must not be sent out in a force 8 onshore wind during the day or a force 7 at night. This is because the brede boats are produced as intermediate lifeboats. In case the Exmouth can't go out due to weather conditions the Weymouth or Torbay boats take over.
